Text.Value: Well. Quite the page turner. I'll get back to it when I have more time to focus.

EditorData.NodeContext: He could feel himself getting pulled into the book and had to fight to close it. He snaps back to the world a little shaken.

Text.Value: *But your will is iron and you brush past these shades of the past, devouring every secret the book has to offer.*
*You try to examine the book, but the longer you stare, the more those piercing, amethyst eyes draw you in.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Hold closed book - read cover] [Brush away dust] [Examine Closer]
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: examining the cover, staring at the eyes

Text.Value: That looks terribly heavy. Why don't you let me carry it for you?
*You feel its connection. Its longing to be opened - to share its secrets.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Take book from pack] [Hold closed book - read cover]

Text.Value: Drop the tome, ready to destroy it.
Turn another page.
Face the darkness with your own, delve deeper.
Force the book closed.
Slam the book shut.
*You see now, life and death are malleable as clay, to be bent and reshaped by your will. By your power.*
We surely shouldn't just leave such a threat out, where anyone could stumble across it.
*You feel better the second the book is out of your hands.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: PC drops the book on the ground and draws their melee weapon.

Text.Value: Excellent.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Takes the book and opens it

Text.Value: *Within the pages, you feel a feral thrashing. Living magic, driven mad by what it was used for...*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Text.Value: *The book radiates power, but the words you read in the Codex echo in your mind, guiding your eyes safely across the page.*
Place the amethyst in the slot on the book's cover.
Leave the book be.
*As you look into the book's amethyst eyes, you can almost hear a voice. You just have to open the book, and it will be yours. Forever.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Take book from pack] [Hold closed book - read cover]

Text.Value: *Black strands of Weave curl all about you, only to sink as into graves as you try to grab hold. Necromantic spells - tantalisingly powerful - slip away forever.*
*You struggle to cling to scraps of what you know - powerful necromancy, you're sure - but it darts away, leaving only Hells' screams.*
Turn to the next page, wary of any arcane tricks.
Turn the page.

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Place Amethyst in book slot] [Book's latches springs open in player's hand]
EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: The player places an amethyst in the book's cover. The book's latch springs open in the player's hands.

Text.Value: Close the book.
*Your limerick's final line pierces something within the book's roiling, vengeful magic.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX eases and slows, then stops.

Text.Value: Drink in the darkness, embracing it, and turn the page.
What are you doing? That's no way to treat a book!
*The whispers, the pain - it all disappears in an instant. You are yourself again.*
*...but they have no hold on you. All you have to do is strike.*
*The book snaps closed. You've seen too much. What profane knowledge is now seared inside of you, you should never have known.*
*The magic inside the book is too strong. The voices grow louder - a cacophony.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX intensifies again, reaching a peak.
EditorData.SFXTags: [KB][GUS-191991] Glyph Voices grow louder, more intense

Text.Value: Please don't open the creepy book.
Turn to the next page.
Tuck the book into your pack.
Ask your patron to guard your mind and turn to the next page.
Close the book.
Concentrate your energy on the book. Channel a sense of calm onto its pages.
Open the book.
Read on and wrest the book's power from it.
*You don't know what he read, but it had an effect. His eyes are hungry, but pained.*
*The symbols move aggressively, probing your mental defences. Your patron is there to defend you, but there's only so much they can do.*
*As you parse the strange glyphs, you can feel the book resisting. Ghostly voices whisper at you from the dark - probing and fighting your mind.*
*You try to close the book, but claws tear at you from the darkness. You can feel them on your body - in your soul, scratching and tearing at your sanity.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Player in agony as they struggle to close the book]

Text.Value: *The glyphs scream, branding your mind with strange runes. You see time rewritten - fate undone - your future thrumming with power.*
*Necromantic power flows from the pages of the book. There is nothing more for you here.*
Close the book.
Put the book away.
Stay on the page, listen to the book. Try to connect with the magic bound within it.
*The glyphs scream, searing your mind. You feel lost, tossed in a sea of arcane power you can neither control nor comprehend.*
Close the book.
*Necromancy. The magical energies of all living things were stolen, corrupted, and sealed in this vile book. It wants someone to share in its insanity.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Text.Value: *The glyphs swarm impatiently. The book wants you to turn the page, to delve deeper. It's hungry.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Text.Value: Refuse the book. Muster your willpower and force the magic to reveal its nature.
*All you can see are those symbols. All you can hear are the whispers - there is nothing else.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the reader's reaction. Player would hear a bunch of indistinct voices talking at once

Text.Value: *Glyphs shift gently before your eyes. Words slip into your mind, onto your lips, forming words you don't understand. And something is trying to reply.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: SFX: disembodied voice calling from beyond the veil VFX of the words moving on the page, and the sensation of shadows moving at the edge of the camera

Text.Value: *Beneath the allure, you feel the faintest echo of torment. There is great power in this book, but also great suffering.*
*Pain grips your mind. The book will not be denied - it will make you read on, or force you to retreat.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: VFX of glyphs and shadows intensify. Instinct voices grow more agitated

Text.Value: *You feel the darkness radiating from the book. It's delicious.*
*You've seen similar books in wizards' libraries - a tome on Thayan magic. A rare and expensive find, but people have gone mad reading less dangerous texts.*
*Assailed from all sides, you careen through the text, absorbing knowledge you can barely comprehend. And yet, for all the violence, you start to see.*
*You open the book to the first page, with its shifting glyphs and strange whispers.*
*You can sense something dark about this tome - something profane.*
Urge your hand to turn another page.
*The book is locked tight, with no visible keyhole - only an oval recess in the cover's mouth.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Take book from pack] [Hold closed book - read cover]

Text.Value: *The heavy cover thumps shut with a strange finality.*
*The symbols move aggressively, probing your mental defences, but you hold strong. For now.*
*The once-indecipherable glyphs now feel dangerously familiar, promising unholy power to those who can take it.*
*The symbols dart beneath your eyes, warping and twisting. Your head throbs, but you almost understand.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Words continue to move on page, the visuals at the edge of the screen intesify

Text.Value: Drown the book's voice with verse. 'There was a young hero called Barry...'
*The voices falter, the anger quells. The magic seems to grow still and quiet, like a soothed beast.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Glyph VFX eases and slows, then stops.

Text.Value: *The world around you is gone - you can only see those glyphs, only hear those voices.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Words continue to move on page, the VFX reach their peak intensity at this page

Text.Value: *The book refuses to open - for you, at least.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Take book from pack] [Hold closed book - read cover]

Text.Value: *Nothing. Just old parchment covered in arcane symbols. The magic sleeps.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: All glyph/shadow VFX gone. Player looking downward at the page, observing

Text.Value: Close the book.
Well. Quite the page turner. I'll get back to it when I have more time to focus.

EditorData.NodeContext: He could feel himself getting pulled into the book and had to fight to close it. He snaps back to the world a little shaken.

Text.Value: *Every symbol seems to burn your eyes. You can feel them searing into your mind - into your soul.*
*You feel claws moving in the shadows. They pull at you, dragging you closer.*
*The book's pull is irresistible; you feel changed, bettered, for having opened it. Suddenly, you are capable of anything - felling mountains, darkening suns, conversing with the dead.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Player opens the book and is drawn to the pages.

Text.Value: Welcome the darkness in the name of your god and turn the page.
Welcome the darkness in the name of your god and turn the page.
Curious. Why don't you take a closer look... I'll observe from back here.
*All you can see are those symbols. All you can hear are the whispers - there is nothing else.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Focus on the reader's reaction. Player would hear a bunch of indistinct voices talking at once

Text.Value: '... Who had to best a tough quest and not tarry. It was going quite well, 'til he fell under a spell...'
*You open the book where you left off, and the voices return, chiding you for your indecision.*
You can't be serious. Give it to me this instant!
*So much promised... but what is sought in return?*
*You've seen much of the book, but its most powerful secrets are guarded by indecipherable glyphs. Without a key, they may be locked away forever.*
*The glyphs seem to burn your inner eye, outraged at your denial.*

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: VFX of glyphs and shadows intensify. Instinct voices grow more agitated

Text.Value: *The claws try to grip your hands, try to stop you, but you slam the book shut before they can take you.*
Give the book to Astarion.
*As you look into the book's amethyst eyes, you can almost hear a voice. You just have to open the book, and it will be yours. Forever.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Take book from pack] [Hold closed book - read cover]

Text.Value: *The book refuses to open.*

EditorData.AnimationTags: [Take book from pack] [Hold closed book - read cover]

Text.Value: *The voices return. Louder. Stronger. Commanding you to stop...*
Channel your magic into the final line. 'Now poor Barry's got a hag he must marry.'
*But as you close the book, a nagging doubt whispers in your mind. What consequences will there be for calling the dead from their rest?*
*You open the book where you left off, the glyphs dancing before your eyes.*
A cursed book? How obvious. Whoever opens it deserves the fate that befalls them.
*The whispers, the pain - it all disappears in an instant. You are yourself again.*

Synopsis: The player finds a book on necromancy - from one of the Red Wizards of Thay. Once read, the book will be bound to whoever tried to read it. Some origins will demand you let them read it, while others will want the book burned. If you read the book, you'll hear strange, distant whispers. The more you read, the stronger the voices will become, and the greater the chance that you'll be driven mad.
